title: Russell Cave National Monument: Collections
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Collections              Collections        Each Twinkle of the Candle Light Tells the Excavators More About the Past Cultures of Russell Cave. Susan Walton    Â    The artifacts they left behind tell the story of the cave: the ebb and flow of habitation, whether the users were family groups or hunting parties, what they wore, what they ate, and the tools they used. As archeologists dug down to the deepest artifacts more than 40 feet below the cave's present floor, they traced the emergence of pottery more than 2,000 years ago, , increasing sophistication of tools and weapons, and the growing trading with other peoples during the Mississippian time period.
